meanings.definition: A device that records the sounds produced by the heart.
meanings.sent1: The doctor used a phonocardiograph to listen to my heart.
meanings.sent2: The phonocardiograph displayed the heartbeat pattern on the screen.
meanings.sent3: The phonocardiograph seemed to be whispering secrets about my heart.
meanings.sent4: Her love for music was like a phonocardiograph, capturing every beat of her heart.
meanings.sent5: The phonocardiograph hummed softly as it recorded the heart's rhythm.

meanings.definition: To use a phonocardiograph to monitor heart sounds.
meanings.sent1: The nurse will phonocardiograph your heart during the check-up.
meanings.sent2: He likes to phonocardiograph his heart regularly to ensure it's healthy.
meanings.sent3: I tried to phonocardiograph my heart with a stethoscope, but it didn't work.
meanings.sent4: She would phonocardiograph her heart every morning, finding comfort in the steady beats.
meanings.sent5: The doctor will phonocardiograph your heart to check for any irregularities.
